commitResults.messageTitle: Add Level 3: Mark as Done * Remove newline at the end when printing list
refactor: Todo into Task and TodoList into TaskList * Accommodate the introduction of ToDos
Add A-TextUiTesting: Automated Text UI Testing * Add plural and singular based on number of tasks * Update .gitignore
Add Level-5: Handle Errors * Add DukeException class to handle handle errors
Add Level 6: Delete * Further encapsulation for task messages in TaskList
Add A-Enums: add enums in the form of Commands * encapsulate errors related to number of arguments inside Command enum * change to while loop

commitResults.messageBody:
Message boxes make the User Interface more appealing.
However, it has a small visual bug if the number of characters exceed
the message box.
* Add new class Message

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: IllegalArgumentException is no longer caught for everything
commitResults.messageBody:
This is so that in the main loop, IllegalArgumentException is no longer
caught for all statements, but only when Command is instantiated.
Thus, we
* Encapsulate initialisation of Command

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor(Message): use foreach loop, add comment
commitResults.messageBody: Foreach loops are cleaner, and comments help to explain the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix(Command): fix arguments not being verified
commitResults.messageBody:
Verification is now done outside the method because previously it just
verifies the command string itself, not the arguments.

This is to make it more extensible in case of multiple inputLoops.
Also, I did
* add credits to StackOverflow for Overriding enums
* abstract out the plural and singular for Tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: fix NullPointerException when calling size of ArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously size() would give an NPE when size() is run without first
initialising taskArr.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor: abstract creation of Deadline and Event into their respective Classes
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to follow OOP principles more closely: all the behaviour/errors
involved in the creation of Deadline and Event are now in their
respective Classes and no longer in both Command and Duke.

It makes more sense for the error checking to be all in one place. As
stated before, this is to follow OOP principles.
Also fix bug where size not being updated for taskWord
